lead_paragraph: A prison official was charged with the theft of 30 miles of pavement in a thinly populated, heavily forested region of northern Russia.
snippet: A prison official was charged with the theft of 30 miles of pavement in a thinly populated, heavily forested region of northern Russia.

headline.main: Missing a Road in Russia? This May Be Why
headline.print_headline: Don’t Blame Snow for Missing Road in Russia’s North

abstract: Russian newspaper Kommersant reports that senior prison official Alexander Protopopov allegedly stole and sold over 7,000 slabs of concrete from 30-mile stretch of public highway in northern Russia's Komi Republic.
